Physiologically, A. samaneae is able to utilize a variety of carbon sources for growth, including glucose, fructose, sucrose, and various amino acids. It is also reported to have the ability to produce various secondary metabolites, which may have potential applications in the pharmaceutical or biotechnological industries.

Overall, Amycolatopsis samaneae is a unique actinobacterial species that has been isolated from the rhizosphere of a tropical tree and exhibits interesting biological and metabolic characteristics worthy of further investigation.
